meanings.sent1: The heavy cargo was too jettisonable for the small aircraft to carry.
meanings.sent2: In case of emergency, the lifeboat is designed to be jettisonable from the ship.
meanings.sent3: The jettisonable supplies were tossed overboard to lighten the load and keep the boat afloat.
meanings.sent4: She treated her toxic relationship as jettisonable baggage, letting go for her own well-being.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut quickly identified the jettisonable parts of the spacecraft to ensure a safe return to Earth.

meanings.definition: Able to be discarded or thrown overboard.
meanings.sent1: The damaged equipment was deemed jettisonable to prevent further harm.
meanings.sent2: During the storm, the crew decided which items were jettisonable to save the ship.
meanings.sent3: The jettisonable trash was tossed into the ocean, leaving the deck clean and tidy.
meanings.sent4: She saw the toxic friendship as jettisonable, deciding to cut ties for her own happiness.
meanings.sent5: The jettisonable cargo was thrown overboard to lighten the load and keep the boat afloat.

meanings.definition: Suitable for being dropped or abandoned.
meanings.sent1: The excess weight was clearly jettisonable to improve the plane's performance.
meanings.sent2: The old equipment was considered jettisonable as the new models arrived.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly referred to his outdated phone as jettisonable, ready to upgrade.
meanings.sent4: The jettisonable ideas were left behind as the team moved forward with a new plan.
meanings.sent5: The unnecessary items were jettisonable, making room for more important cargo.
